children.subject:
Hey, thanks for your detailed response! I'll try to petition for 47C but I'll prepare for looking into the things that I might be missing inmy 61c knowledge.

Much appreciated.
Yeah of course! And re-reading my response, I meant "non-negligible" not "negligible" haha

For CS47C, it is (or at least for me was) a comparison of an old course I took vs. 61C, where I had to do the CS61C assignments that covered topics my course didn't. I'm guessing it will be something similar for you, so you might be able to extrapolate how much work that will be. If you don't have any course to map it to me it might be a bit more difficult to get into 47C, although I am not sure.

Regarding declaring CS, I'm not sure the timeline, but I also think if you phase I upper divs you can probably get into ones that you like since many do not have reserved seats (162 being an example, I'm pretty sure).

61B and 70 is definitely very doable together. Theoretically adding on 61C is as well, but 61C is very high workload as far as I know so it may come down to how much you need to do of it. That being said, I have definitely taken schedules that are comparable to doing all three together and it is very possible, but it will be a negligible amount of work. My best advice would be to start problem sets and projects literally the day they are assigned if you are able, as that helps you stay on top of things.

history.content:
I'm looking to declare this fall semester and clear 61C this semester so I can take the systems upper div courses next semester. This puts me in a position where I might have a schedule that seems to have a lot of workload- 

CS 61B

CS 70

CS 61C (or 47C if I can get approval)

2 unit class

- I'm very comfortable with computer systems/arch but only have knowledge about data struct/algo from my CC courses

- Would it be possible for me to declare CS the end of fall in time to take an upper div course during the spring? If not, what do CS transfers usually take their second semester?

- Has anyone had a similar schedule? What was the semester like for you?

- If I decide to defer 61C to next semester, would it be possible to take an upper div in lieu of the 61C prereq?

Thank you all (:
history.subject: LS transfer schedule
